0: LARGO — The mother of a 2-year-old whose body was found in a wooded area Tuesday night admitted to hitting the child, causing seizures and resulting in his death. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR According to the arrest affidavit, 21-year-old Charisse Stinson told police during questioning that she struck 2-year-old Jordan Belliveau in the face "during a moment of frustration" after the child suffered an "unexplained, serious injury" to his right leg. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR She told police she struck the child in the face with the back of her hand Saturday night, causing his head to strike a wall in her home. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The blow caused the child to have seizures during the night, according to the affidavit. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR As the child’s condition deteriorated on Sunday, according to the report, Stinson took the child to a wooded area during the night and left him there. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Injuries found on the child’s body are consistent with Stinson’s statement, according to the affidavit. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Stinson is being held without bail at the Pinellas County Jail and faces a charge of first-degree murder. She is scheduled to have a first appearance in court today. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Stinson’s arrest ended a two-day search for the child, who was reported missing Sunday morning when she first called 911. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR For more than 60 hours, police scoured nearby woods, divers searched ponds and investigators hauled away dumpsters around the mother’s apartment. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Police released a sketch of a man the mother claimed had offered her and Jordan a ride Saturday night, then struck her in the face. She told police the next thing she knew, she woke up in Largo Central Park and the child was missing. Police released a gas station surveillance video of a possible witness in the case. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The child’s body was found late Tuesday afternoon in the woods east of Lake Avenue NE and McMullen Road, behind a baseball field at the Largo Sports Complex. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR This is a developing story. Stay with tampabay.com for updates. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Times staff writers Zachary T. Sampson and Josh Solomon contributed to this report.
